text.p: Following are the main stories in Wednesday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on Tuesday night declared open the 421-metre Kuala Lumpur Tower, Asia's tallest telecommunications tower, amid a display of fireworks.
-- Technical hitches led to the postponement of the signing of the Bakun dam contract, said Mahathir.
-- Shareholders removed Seal Inc Bhd's chairman Jaffar Abdul, his deputy and two directors, and replaced them with a new management team.

-- Stockbroking houses may be subject to a tiered regulatory system similar to that for banks and finance companies in efforts to further liberalise the capital market, said Securities Commission chairman Munir Abdul Majid.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad on Tuesday unveiled a prototype of the Malaysian natural gas vehicle, a collaboration between national car-maker Proton and state-owned oil firm Petronas.
-- The Securities Commission has submitted a proposal to the government to build a benchmark yield curve in its bid to develop the ringgit bond market, said commision chairman Munir Majid.
